transcript: chairs, and a clavichord. One adjutant, near- est the door, was sitting at the table in a Per- sian dressing gown, writing. Another, the red, stout Nesvitski, lay on a bed with his arms un- der his head, laughing with an officer who had sat down beside him. A third was playing a Vi- ennese waltz on the clavichord, while a fourth, lying on the clavichord, sang the tune. Bol- k6nski was not there.
